post.description: Will create a new survey from the supplied JSON in the body. A survey is just a special type of Challenge that includes a question with answers. When creating a Survey object you can within the same json body include Task children under the "children" key. When creating the Survey, leave the ID field out of the body json, if updating (generally use the PUT method) include the ID field.

200.description: The newly created Survey with a unique id. The Survey object contains a challenge object however the Challenge object is flattened so the "general", "creation", "priority", and "extra" fields are remove and the keys from that object are moved into the challenge object.

304.description: Not updated responding with empty payload if Survey already exists and nothing to update

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The JSON structure for the Survey body, include the key "children" to create Task children objects. The survey object is just a special type of Challenge object, and is identical to the Challenge object other than including the "answers" key. Although the model schema for the Challenge shows a hierarchy include "general", "creation", "priority" and "extra" this JSON structure can be flattened and you can exclude those top level keys and have the children in the root level.
